body.p: The undersigned Citizens of Union County respectfully Petition your Excellency to pardon Ro P Warring who stands charged by Indictment in the Union Equity & Criminal Court with the Murder of Ro Wm Buckman --

The facts are about these, Buckman had been living with Peter Abell who married a sister of Ro P Warring, & had made an attempt ^by force^ to accomplish an illicit intercourse with Mrs Abell, on their way home from a neighbours while She was under his care & protection, and was at only prevented from it, by the her screams of, this was Communicated by her to her husband & Brother and in a short time thereafter Buckman was found killed on the road near where she had told her husband & Brother
the forcible attempt had been made most of us even on the ground immediately after the occurance of the deed or heard the testimony of the witnesses who were there, And no sign of Warring having been on the ground was to be found, And the only evidence agt Warring was some threats made about the time his sister told him of the insult & attempt at force on her by Buckman.
Abell & Warring were Indicted Abel has been acquitted & Warring state is charged with & --
We ask you to pardon him, and refrain from any of opinion about others Convicted with the affair

Warring is poor & unable to meet the expences of such a trial, and is in fast failing health & as we learn cannot live long -- We join with her Mother in asking you to pardon him, while living, and hope
you will do so

Respy
Willis G Hughes
H B Eaty
George payne
J B payne
Jno T. Borne
W. H. Wheeler
James Threlkeld
Wm W Threlkeld
N W Waggener
Ben. D. Cissell
J. H. Grifin
J S Giger M. U. C. C
D. H. Hughes

Warrings case -- Union
Rejected --
B. Magoffin
